column2: U.S. court revives shareholder lawsuit vs. Allergan over BotoxUPDATE 1-U.S. court revives Botox-linked shareholder suit against Allergan SAN FRANCISCO
column3: Sept 2 A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday revived a 2010 shareholder lawsuit against Allergan Inc  over allegations the company improperly marketed and labeled the cosmetic drug Botox.  UPDATE 1-U.S. court revives Botox-linked shareholder suit against Allergan SAN FRANCISCO

column2: Florida-bound Delta flight diverted over reclining seat dispute An argument over leg room and reclining seats forced a Florida-bound flight from New York to divert to a different airport late on Monday
column3: the third such incident of a midair disruption caused by passengers in about a week.

column2: U.S. judge approves settlement in eBay case over tech hiringUPDATE 1-U.S. judge approves DOJ settlement with eBay over tech hiring SAN FRANCISCO
column3: Sept 2 A U.S. judge on Tuesday approved a settlement between federal antitrust authorities and eBay Inc over allegations that eBay agreed to refrain from soliciting a rival company's employees.  UPDATE 1-U.S. judge approves DOJ settlement with eBay over tech hiring SAN FRANCISCO
column4: Sept 2 A U.S. judge on Tuesday approved a settlement between federal antitrust authorities and eBay Inc over allegations that eBay agreed to refrain from soliciting a rival company's employees. SAN FRANCISCO
column5: Sept 2 A U.S. judge on Tuesday approved a settlement in a lawsuit between federal antitrust authorities and eBay Inc over allegations that eBay agreed it would not solicit employees from a rival company.UPDATE 1-U.S. judge approves DOJ settlement with eBay over tech hiring SAN FRANCISCO
column6: Sept 2 A U.S. judge on Tuesday approved a settlement between federal antitrust authorities and eBay Inc over allegations that eBay agreed to refrain from soliciting a rival company's employees.
